generif.text: MVP gene expression regulated by alternative splicing due to generation of an upstream open reading frame
findings suggest that Tax-related drug resistance of ATL cells is due to LRP and not MDR1, as reported previously.
relationship between the expression of lung resistance-related protein (lrp) gene or multidrug resistance-associated protein (mrp) gene and prognosis in untreated acute leukemia (AL) patients
LRP/MVP mRNA expression decreased as AML disease evolved, suggesting it is not associated with clinical resistant disease in AML.
identification as a dominant PTEN-binding protein in a yeast two-hybrid screen
RNA expression of this protein in breast cancer correlates with response to chemotherapy.
expression of lung resistance-related protein in differentiated cells and subsequent expression after chemotherapy suggests that it plays a role in therapy-induced differentiation
neither the presence nor the degree of immunoreactivity to MVP/LRP showed any correlation with either tumor grade or the presence of brain invasion
In gangliogliomas, western blot analysis showed a consistent increase in major vault protein expression compared with control cortex.

MVP and BCRP were expressed ubiquitously in brain capillary endothelium. Ectopic upregulation of MVP was seen in hilar neurons in HS, dysplastic neurons in FCD, and lesional neurons in DNT. Only in HS cases were rare extralesional neurons immunoreactive.
Results suggest that major vault protein functions as a novel scaffold protein for both SHP-2 and Erk.
The inverted MED1 element and the LRP130 protein have a role in transcription of the MVP gene.
Expression of LRP tended to be down-regulated in carcinomas. Moreover, the expression of LRP inversely correlated with tumor grades.
Vaults play no direct role in the multiple drug resistance phenotype in non-small cell lung carcinoma cells; their cellular function remains unknown.
MVP is localized to the cell nucleus in an astrocytoma cell line.
The nasopharyngeal carcinoma patients with positive LRP and TS expression may be less sensitive to chemotherapy with DDP + 5-FU.
Results report the structure of the main repeat element in human major vault protein.

Data show that the interaction between Src and major vault protein (MVP) is critically dependent on Src activity and protein (MVP) tyrosyl phosphorylation, which are induced by epidermal growth factor stimulation.

The expression of mRNA for MDR1 and LRP was determined in bone marrow samples from control, de novo acute myelocytic leukemia, myelodysplastic syndrome(MDS), MDS at the time of overt leukemia(OL) transformation (MDS --> OL),and after transformation (OL).
LRP expression affects complete remission and survival rates in acute leukemia
Taken together, these results suggest that ZNF540 may act as a transcriptional repressor in MAPK signaling pathway to mediate cellular functions.
LRP was highly expressed and is associated with adult T-cell leukemia/lymphoma
PTEN reportedly interacts in vitro with the EF hand-like motif of major vault protein in a Ca(2+)-dependent manner in a breast tumor cell line.

Sequence analysis and molecular modeling were used to show that MVP and the toxic anion resistance protein, TelA of Rhodobacter sphaeroides strain 2.4.1, share a novel fold that consists of a three-stranded antiparallel beta-sheet.
MVP expression is involved in one of the mechanisms of drug resistance in osteosarcoma and is induced by chemotherapy
results suggest that LRP expression observed in NSCLC, maintained through the carcinogenesis process of respiratory cells, is not altered by the increased number of copies of chromosome 16.

results report that MVP is rapidly recruited to lipid rafts when lung epithelial cells are infected with Pseudomonas aeruginosa; MVP was also essential for optimal epithelial cell internalization and clearance of P. aeruginosa
statistically significant correlations between MRP1 and LRP expression and between MRP1 or LRP expression and MDR1 expression
Determination of P-glycoprotein, MDR-related protein 1, breast cancer resistance protein, and lung-resistance protein expression in leukemic stem cells of acute myeloid leukemia.
MVP and IGF-1R expression were related in clinical cervical tumours and confer reduced long-term local control in patients who achieved clinical complete response to radiochemotherapy.
MVP is important in the resistance of senescent human diploid fibroblasts to apoptosis by modulation of Bcl-2 expression by c-Jun NH(2)-terminal kinase pathway.
In multiple myeloma, chemotherapy induces integrin beta-1 expression which in turn upregulates LRP, leading to antineoplastic drug resistance.
Data demonstrate that exposure of cells to hyperosmotic stress induces major vault protein, which might play a role in protecting cells from the adverse effects of osmotic stress.
Our study reports expression of MRP and LRP in nasal NK/T-cell lymphoma
The expression of EGFR and LRP could be used to predict chemotherapy resistance and prognosis of ovarian cancer.
MVP is involved in intracellular signaling, cell survival, differentiation a& innate immunity. Age-related upregulation of MVP facilitates apoptosis resistance. Review.

Tumor Suppressor Protein p53 contributes to the major vault protein -facilitated resistance to apoptosis by senescent human diploid fibroblasts by transcriptionally activating MVP gene in these cells.
P-gp and LRP expressions but not MRP expression are important in the mechanism of drug resistance associated with a poor clinical outcome in previously untreated non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.
tumor hypoxia is associated with high major vault protein expression in clinical cervical tumors
mRNA expression predicts chemotherapy response and survival in patients with non-small cell lung cancer who received neoadjuvant cisplatin-based chemotherapy
Patients expressing both lung resistance protein and multidrug resistance-related protein genes had poorer outcomes and had worse 2-year survivalts.
Data show that major vault protein (MVP), a lung resistance associated protein, is a binding partner of YPEL4.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)

Loss of p53-related suppression of lung resistance-related protein through Y-box binding protein 1 may be the reason for LRP expression increase, and, therefore, chemotherapy resistance in tumor cells.

MVP (major vault protein) expression increases dramatically in tissue samples from the frontal cortex of patients with surgically treated refractory epilepsy patients compared to histologically normal frontal lobe samples from controls.

results suggest that the high expression of LRP in patients with tongue carcinoma indicates that intrinsic drug resistance may exist in tongue carcinoma, and is associated with tumor differentiation and cisplatin resistance in tongue carcinoma.
MVP is hijacked by L. monocytogenes in order to counteract the autophagy process, a finding that could have major implications in deciphering the cellular role of vault particles.
LRP and MRP play a role in multidrug resistance in non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) and are related to prognosis in patients with NSCLC

Histopathology demonstrated increased amount of MVP/LRP proteins in cancer and showed translocation possibility between cytoplasm and nuclear envelope, which can be crucial in the prevention of nucleus against anticancer drugs. [review]
These findings suggest MVP as a novel player in resistance against EGFR inhibition.
GSTP1 and LRP have different effects on multi-drug resistance in adult acute leukemia.
MVP and IGF-1R expression are related in oral squamous cell carcinoma and conferred reduced long-term survival in patients suffering from advanced stages of the disease
TRAIL may reduce the expression of drug-resistant genes MDR1, LRP and GST-pi, thereby participating in the reversion of the multidrug resistance of gastric cancer.
Lung resistance-related protein is associated with malignant ascitic cells and recurrence in ovarian serous carcinoma.
The phosphorylation-dependent binding between 14-3-3epsilon and MVP inhibits the drug-resistant activity of MVP.
the protein levels of MVP, TEP1 and vPARP are actually increased in the highergrade tumors suggesting existence of post-transcriptional regulation of vault component production.
rs4788187, rs3815824, rs3815823 variants of the MVP gene are associated neither with predisposition for epilepsy nor with AED-resistance in the population that we have studied.
hyperosmotic stress upregulates Sp1 expression levels by inhibiting ubiquitination through the activation of JNK, and the induction of Sp1 expression directly enhances MVP transcription.
USF1 binding to an E-box element may be critical for basal MVP promoter activation.
Study demonstrates that vaults have a tumour-promoting potential by stabilizing EGFR/PI3K-mediated migration and survival pathways in human glioblastoma.
Bag3-MVP is an important complex that regulates a potent prosurvival signaling pathway and contributes to chemotherapy resistance in breast cancer
LDL increases ABCB1, ABCC1, and LRP expression in a human doxorubicin-resistant uterine sarcoma cell line.
The association of MVP amplification and PTEN deletion could be a potential biomarker in glioblastoma.
MVP genetic polymorphisms and haplotypes may not be associated with drug resistance of partial epilepsy in the Chinese Han population.
NSCLCs [ non-small cell lung cancer ] expressing P-gp [P-glycoprotein ]/LRP [ lung resistance-related protein] bear the EGFR [epidermal growth factor receptor] mutation in exon 19 or 21 easily.

We believe that for the first time, genetic variants at XRCC6 and MVP genes are associated with risk of more aggressive disease, and would be taken into account when assessing the malignancy of prostate cancer
KPNA7 binding and nuclear transfer was validated for two proteins, MVP and ZNF414. MVP and ZNF414 have a key role in the regulation of pancreatic cancer cell growth.
Taxus chinensis var.-mediated downregulation of MRP1, MDR1, and LRP might contribute to the reversal of drug resistance in non-small cell lung cancer stem cells.
involved in doxorubicin resistance of non-small cell lung cancer
Knockout of MVP leads to miR-193a accumulation in the exosomal donor cells instead of exosomes, inhibiting tumour progression.

Study found significant upregulation of MVP and BCRP whereas MRP1 and UGT1A4 were unaltered in drug resistant epilepsy brains. While upregulation of BCRP was significantly higher in mesial temporal lobe epilepsy (9.34+/-0.45; p<0.05), upregulation of MVP was significantly higher in focal cortical dysplasia (2.94+/-0.65; p<0.01).
Major vault protein is important in the drug resistance of cancer cells, but it requires the presence of vPARP for full activity
KIF4A promotes drug resistance of lung adenocarcinoma cells through transporting LRP-based vaults along microtubules towards the cell membrane

B7-H3 is associated with the major vault protein (MVP) and activates MEK through MVP-enhancing B-RAF and MEK interaction. B7-H3 expression increases stem cell population by binding to MVP which regulates the activation of the MAPK kinase pathway. Depletion of MVP blocks the activation of MEK induced by B7-H3 and dramatically inhibits B7-H3 induced stem cells.

The expression levels of LRP and GSTP1 in primary epithelial ovarian cancer were the highest, followed by borderline adenoma tissues, and lowest levels in benign tumor tissues. The difference between resistant gene negative-expression and positive-expression of chemotherapy efficiency, disease free survival time, and recurrence time were statistically significant.
This study provides evidence that Notch1 activates AKT pathway and promotes EMT partly through direct activation of MVP.

Study shows that adipocytes induce major vault protein (MVP)-related multidrug-resistant phenotype in breast cancer cells, which could contribute to obesity-related chemoresistance. In a series of human breast tumors, a gradient of MVP expression was observed, and it was higher at the invasive front, where tumor cells are at close proximity to adipocytes, highlighting the clinical relevance of these results.

This is the first report showing that high bone marrow LRP expression predicts significant favorable therapeutic outcome. Peripheral blood LRP expression as well as marrow and blood MDR1 and MRP2 expression have no predictive value in AML patients treated with standard dose cytarabine and daunorubicin 3+7 regimen.

Study identified major vault protein (MVP) as a suppressor for NF-kappaB signaling in macrophages. Up-regulation of MVP expression in macrophages of visceral adipose tissues was correlated with obesity in both humans and mice, suggesting that MVP be involved in obesity-associated inflammation.Results demonstrate that macrophage MVP constitutes a key constraint of NF-kappaB signaling thereby suppressing metabolic diseases.

Study found that MVP expression was significantly up-regulated in non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) tissues. Higher MVP expression was correlated with better clinical outcomes in patients with lung cancer. Further findings demonstrate that MVP may act as a lung tumor suppressor via inhibiting STAT3 pathway.

Y-box binding protein 1 (YB-1) promotes gefitinib resistance in lung adenocarcinoma cells by activating AKT signaling and epithelial-mesenchymal transition through targeting major vault protein (MVP).
Proteomic analyses identify major vault protein as a prognostic biomarker for fatal prostate cancer.
Constitutive GLI1 expression in chondrosarcoma is regulated by major vault protein via mTOR/S6K1 signaling cascade.
MVP Expression Facilitates Tumor Cell Proliferation and Migration Supporting the Metastasis of Colorectal Cancer Cells.
Major vault protein regulates tumor-associated macrophage polarization through interaction with signal transducer and activator of transcription 6.

BP.term: negative regulation of epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway
negative regulation of protein tyrosine kinase activity

interpro.desc: Major vault protein repeat domain superfamily
Major vault protein repeat domain 2 superfamily

name: major vault protein
summary: This gene encodes the major component of the vault complex. Vaults are multi-subunit ribonucleoprotein structures that may be involved in nucleo-cytoplasmic transport. The encoded protein may play a role in multiple cellular processes by regulating the MAP kinase, JAK/STAT and phosphoinositide 3-kinase/Akt signaling pathways. The encoded protein also plays a role in multidrug resistance, and expression of this gene may be a prognostic marker for several types of cancer. Alternatively spliced transcript variants have been observed for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, May 2012].
